content.description: This climb starts on the big pockets at about chest height on the lip of the overhang and follows the obvious crack. the top out can be a bit rough but its a good problem overall.
content.protection: Few pads and a spotter would be worth having
content.location: This climb is the crack right in the middle of moonrise wall

content.description: This problem begins on two small edges and goes straight up the middle of the boulder to the jugs on the top out.
content.protection: a pad or two are enough for the landing and a spotter is useful for keeping away for the boulder in front of the climb.
content.location: Located on the northeast face of the first turtle

content.description: Start with both hands of large crimpers and follow the obvious line of holds straight to the top of the boulder.
content.protection: one pad is fine for this problem and a spotter couldn't hurt either.
content.location: This is the most obvious left line on the church boulder which is located on the south side of the canyon a little after the second major bend in the canyon past moonrise wall.

content.description: This is a nice short warm up climb or challenging one move wonder for a beginner. very fun.
content.protection: one pad is good for this short climb
content.location: This climb starts low on the northeast side of the last turtle boulder on a large shelf. make a couple big moves straight out to the obvious slopers and top out on the jugs just above them.

content.description: This area is one of the most aesthetic in all of arizona. East Clear Creek runs through the bottom of the canyon and can flood after snow melt and heavy rain. the rock is limestone through the majority of the canyon and turns to sandstone east down the canyon towards blue ridge reservoir. This area is relatively secluded with the occasional four wheeler or small group of hikers wandering through. The weather is best in the fall with the water low and the temps down.
